ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned the basics of various topics of science that I have never been exposed to before.
This course gave me insight into a multitude of science topics that are very relevant in the modern day.
You learn differing amounts about the latest breakthroughs and events in different niche subjects of science at Yale taught through guest lectures.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: This course was very interesting and the professors brought in are obviously very passionate about their work. I wish this course was more of a seminar style since it is a first year seminar. Every week felt like another lecture to me and the lectures were very long as well. I wish they would either be shorter or split into more days because after a long period of lecturing, things that were interesting start to get boring.
Some topics I wish could be explored in greater depth or over a longer span of time.

So far only one of the guest lectures has been exciting and interesting (the chemistry professor) the other professors seemed to be giving the same presentation they had been giving for at least 8 years and seemed less invested. The quizzes always felt completely unrelated to what we learned.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would recommend this course to a student who is interested in science, but not interested in pursuing it. It would add a nice variety, for instance, to a very humanities driven course load.
Yes, it is an entertaining course that could serve practical usage as many of the topics taught are relevant in modern society.
This is not a seminar! Its a lecture with a quiz and sometimes a debate thrown in. I would recommend for non science majors.
